block.comment: Create a VisionPortal.Builder object so you can specify attributes about the cameras.
Set the stream format.
Enable the live camera preview.
Set whether to automatically stop the LiveView (RC preview) when all vision processors are disabled.
Set whether the VisionPortal should automatically start streaming when you issue a .build() call on this VisionPortal.Builder object.
Set whether the statistics overlay should be shown on the LiveView.
Set the LiveView container id.
Set the camera resolution.
Add the AprilTag processor.
Add the color blob locator processor.
Add the predominant color processor.
Build the VisionPortal object and assign it to a variable.
Enable or disable the AprilTag processor.
Get whether the AprilTag processor is enabled.
Get the state of the camera.
Save the next frame to the given file.
Temporarily stop the streaming session. This can save CPU resources, with the ability to resume quickly when needed.
Resume the streaming session if previously stopped.
Temporarily stop the LiveView (RC preview).
Start the LiveView (RC preview) again.
Get the current vision frame rate.
Get the ExposureControl object, to allow adjusting the camera's exposure.
Get the FocusControl object, to allow adjusting the camera's focus length.
Get the GainControl object, to allow adjusting the camera's gain.
Get the PtzControl object, to allow adjusting the camera's pan, tilt, and zoom.
Get the WhiteBalanceControl object, to allow adjusting the camera's white balance temperature.

Set which Vision Portal is the source of the DS Camera Stream image. Default is the last built Vision Portal.
This setSource() Block is useful under MultiPortal. The camera view of the designated Vision Portal will be routed to the Driver Station (DS) Camera Stream. An OpMode can change this while running, during the INIT stage.
Save computing resources by closing the camera stream, if no longer needed.
Create a new AprilTagProcessor.Builder object and assign it to a variable.
Set whether or not to draw the axes on detections.
Set whether or not to draw the cube projection on detections.
Set whether or not to draw the tag outline on detections.
Set whether or not to draw the tag ID on detections.
Set the lens intrinsics, obtained from a camera calibration.
Set whether any warnings about camera calibration should be suppressed.
Set the number of threads to use for detection.
Set the output units.
Set the tag family to be detected.
Set the tag library.
Build the AprilTag processor and assign it to a variable.
Create the AprilTag processor and assign it to a variable.
Get a list containing the latest detections, which may be stale.

Get a list containing detections that were detected since the last call to this method, or null if no new detections are available. This is useful to avoid re-processing the same detections multiple times.
Set the detector decimation.
Set the pose solver.
Get the per tag average pose solve time.
Get the AprilTagLibrary for the current season.
Get the AprilTagLibrary for the Into The Deep FTC game.
Get the AprilTagLibrary for the tags used in the sample OpModes.
Create a new AprilTagLibrary.Builder objectand assigns it to a variable.
Set whether to allow a new tag to be added when the library already contains a tag with the same ID.
Add a tag to the AprilTagLibrary.Builder.
Add a tag, without pose information, to the AprilTagLibrary.Builder.
Add a tag to the AprilTagLibrary.Builder.
Add all the tags from the given AprilTagLibrary to the AprilTagLibrary.Builder.
Build the AprilTag library and assign it to a variable.
Look up a tag id in the AprilTagLibrary.
Create a new AprilTagMetdata object and assign it to a variable.
Create a new AprilTagMetdata object and assign it to a variable.
Create a new ColorBlobLocatorProcessor.Builder object and assign it to a variable.
Build the ColorBlobLocatorProcessor and assign it to a variable.
Get the aspect ratio of this blob, i.e. the ratio of the longer side of the "boxFit" bounding box to the shorter side.
Get a "best-fit" bounding box (called "boxFit", of type RotatedRect) for this blob.
Store the 4 corners of "myBoxFit" (rotatedRect) as a List of Points in the "myPoints" variable, clockwise from top left corner.
Get the x value of myHorizontalBoxFit (top left corner).
Get the y value of myHorizontalBoxFit (top left corner).
Get the width value of myHorizontalBoxFit.
Get the height value of myHorizontalBoxFit.
Create a new PredominantColorProcessor.Builder object and assign it to a variable.
Build the PredominantColorProcessor and assign it to a variable.
Get the current exposure mode value.
Set the exposure mode value.
Get whether the given ExposureControl.Mode is supported.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) exposure.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) exposure.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) exposure.
Set the exposure.
Get whether exposure is supported.
Get the AE priority.
Set the AE priority.
Get the current focus mode value.
Set the focus mode value.
Get whether the given FocusControl.Mode is supported.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) focus length.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) focus length.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) focus length.
Set the focus length.
Get whether focus is supported.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) gain.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) gain.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) gain.
Set the gain. Requires Exposure Control Mode to be MANUAL.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) virtual pan/tilt.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) virtual pan/tilt.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) virtual pan/tilt.
Set the virtual pan/tilt.
Get the pan value from the given PanTiltHolder object.
Get the tilt value from the given PanTiltHolder object.
Set the pan field in the given PanTiltHolder object.
Set the tilt value in the given PanTiltHolder object
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) zoom.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) zoom.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) zoom.
Set the zoom.
Get the current white balance mode value.
Set the white balance mode value.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) white balance temperature, in degrees Kelvin.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) white balance temperature, in degrees Kelvin.
Get the current (or minimum or maximum) white balance temperature, in degrees Kelvin.
Set the white balance temperature, in degrees Kelvin.
